Home.desc: I am a 3rd year student of Appiled Computer Science at the Wroclaw University of Science and Technology. At the end of 2019, I started with C++ but currently I am mainly interested in web technologies.
Home.universityLink: Wroclaw University of Science and Technology

Projects.title: Projects
Projects.subtitle: My work effects
Projects.paragraph: Some of my proudest nerd moments

myanimedb.title: MyAnimeDB
myanimedb.subtitle: Website for anime fans
myanimedb.desc: A web application for viewing and rating anime, created on the model of MyAnimeList.net and Shinden.pl. Made as part of a class subject.

it-salary-predictor.title: IT Salary Predictor
it-salary-predictor.subtitle: Earnings calculator
it-salary-predictor.desc: A website used to predict earnings and to present the analysis of job offers in the IT industry. Prediction is based on machine learning.

chatterbox.title: Chatterbox
chatterbox.subtitle: Simple chat web app writted with microservices
chatterbox.desc: Used simplified CQRS pattern and event-driven architecture. Microservices communicate with each other by RabbitMQ broker. We can communicate in real time, gettings notifications and more...

l2play.title: L2Play
l2play.subtitle: Mobile iOS app
l2play.desc: Social media application for gamers, you can create posts follow people, exploring games and get recommendations based on your game collections.

AboutMe.subtitle: something
AboutMe.title: About me
AboutMe.content: Currently, I work most in the area of ​​Web Development. On the frontend side, I work most often with Next.js, while the backend is created in Go, FastAPI or - depending on the project - Nest.js or Spring. Recently, I have become particularly interested in microservice architectures, especially event-driven and CQRS-based approaches.

studies.event: Starting studies in Applied Computer Science at the Wrocław University of Science and Technology.
studies.desc: My studies allowed me to develop my passion for programming, taught me how to work in a group, and provided me with a lot of computer theory.
